wikipedia_page.main: Robert Samuel Herring  (27 July 1897 – 11 September 1953) was a British officer who served in the Army and the Royal Air Force in both World Wars. In World War I he became a flying ace, and spent most of World War II as a prisoner of the Japanese.

response: *Robert Herring MC (1897–1973), an officer in the British Army and RAF in both World Wars, was born here.
* Robert Herring (poet) (1903–1975), British writer and poet
* Robert Herring (businessman), California businessman and founder of Wealth TV
* Robert Herring (RAF officer) (1896–1973), World War I flying ace
| With 2nd Lieutenant Robert Herring as gunner/observer
